meanings.definition: Having the sour taste or flavor of vinegar.
meanings.sent1: The salad dressing was so vinegary that it made my lips pucker.
meanings.sent2: She wrinkled her nose at the vinegary smell coming from the kitchen.
meanings.sent3: The vinegary lemonade tasted like someone accidentally poured vinegar in it.
meanings.sent4: The vinegary clouds in the sky seemed to foretell a storm.
meanings.sent5: The vinegary taste of the pickles lingered on his tongue long after he finished eating.

meanings.sent1: The old book had a vinegary smell that reminded her of her grandmother's pantry.
meanings.sent2: The vinegary tone of his voice hinted at his annoyance.
meanings.sent3: The vinegary color of the sunset painted the sky in shades of red and orange.
meanings.sent4: Her words had a vinegary effect on his mood, leaving him feeling sour.
meanings.sent5: The vinegary texture of the fabric made her think of pickled cucumbers.
